summary: This is an email chain from August 2019 discussing overtime (OT) occurrences at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, specifically in relation to staffing during the period when Jeffrey Epstein was held there. The correspondence questions whether providing information about temporary duty (TDY) staff from other locations would help clarify that overtime was not solely performed by the current correctional services complement.

persons.name: J. Regional Director Northeast Region
persons.context: The sender of the email inquiring about overtime data and staffing at MCC New York, suggesting that temporary duty officers from other locations contributed to overtime during a specific 30-day period.

events.title: Overtime Analysis at MCC NY
events.description: Discussion of overtime occurrences at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York over a period of time, with a focus on a 30-day portion where approximately 15 officers from other locations were on temporary duty.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated August 16, 2019, discussing overtime at MCC New York.
It references a 30-day period where approximately 15 officers from other locations were on temporary duty (TDY) to MCC NY.
The inquiry suggests that overtime during that period was performed by TDY staff, not just the current correctional services complement.
The context implies this analysis may relate to the period when Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at MCC New York prior to his death.
